Dawn FionaLevel 5. GeniusAnswered on 14 Aug 2018I'll break it down accordingly to what I believe is best:​Get educated first. Invest in your financial literacy.Read investment books, and/or attend investment courses (most aren't value-for-money / too costly for too basic content, please read my reviews for the ones I recommend, or read the reviews on Seedly to find out more sentiments). SGX offers some great courses, workshops and free webinars too!Readings:http://www.sgbudgetbabe.com/2017/07/recommended-books-on-personal-finance.htmlhttp://www.sgbudgetbabe.com/2018/02/what-you-must-know-before-investing-in.htmlhttp://www.sgbudgetbabe.com/2018/05/what-stock-can-i-invest-in-that-is-low.htmlhttp://www.sgbudgetbabe.com/2018/08/dr-wealth-factor-based-investing-course.html​Understand yourself and what you're investing for.Time duration? Risk appetite? What makes you unable to sleep at night? What's your investing style? What are your emotional strengths and weaknesses?Readings:http://www.sgbudgetbabe.com/2015/04/10-questions-to-ask-yourself-before.htmlhttp://www.sgbudgetbabe.com/2016/07/10-ways-to-fail-at-stock-investing.html​Understand the different types of investments available before you make a choice.REITS: http://www.sgbudgetbabe.com/2017/08/understanding-different-types-of-reits.htmlETFs: http://www.sgbudgetbabe.com/2017/10/what-you-should-look-at-before-buying.htmlDividend stocks: http://www.sgbudgetbabe.com/2018/02/what-you-must-know-before-investing-in.htmlValue / growth stocks: http://www.sgbudgetbabe.com/2018/05/what-stock-can-i-invest-in-that-is-low.html​Learn about portfolio management and diversification.The Singapore Permanent Portfolio: http://www.sgbudgetbabe.com/2015/10/a-fail-safe-method-to-investing-to-beat.html​​I would NEVER put 100% of my money in REITs. They're affected by economic cycles and can be cyclical, so it is never a good idea to put all my wealth in a single basket. Wouldn't want a single fall to break all my precious golden eggs!0 comments1

Good Day Every DayLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 15 Sep 2018Do your homework first. Understand your risk profile. Choose the instruments that suit your profile. Invest in 100% reits is not viable in a rising interest rate environment. Diversification in different markets using different instruments is more viable. 0 comments0
